result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobbie S. Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All restitution has been paid in full from the bond funds posted in this matter.

1) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
2) The court assessed only the DNA surcharge and waived all other court costs in this matter. 
3) All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.  The defendant has sixty (60) days to make payment of any amount ordered unless other arrangements are made with the Clerk of Court's office. Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    
Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobbie S. Gordon

records.addlTxt: Full restitution sent

1:47 PM Defendant Bobbie S. Gordon appeared by phone.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Bobbie S. Gordon.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Erdman: def pleading guilty to Count 2: misdemeanor theft.  
Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2: misdemeanor theft and orders a JOC; Count 1 is DRI.  DA assures VR compliance; asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
$550 restitution- to be paid in full from bond funds posted.
$200 court costs; DNA only, waives other court costs. 60 days to pay the remaining balance after bond applies.  
Appeal rights provided.  DNA and fingerprints to be provided the BCSD within 60 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

10:07 AM Defendant Bobbie S. Gordon appeared by phone.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Bobbie S. Gordon.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: resolution for misdemeanor agreement, 1 year probation.  Off the record 10:08 AM.  Back on the record 10:17 AM, same appearances.  Can't convert to plea- not VR compliant.  Defendant must appear in person (needs to provide prints).
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bobbie S. Gordon appeared by phone.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Bobbie S. Gordon.  Case was set for bail/bond hearing, but def has bonded out, so now on for status conference.  Case on for Status Conference.  Court notes def posted $664.50; State says he will send an offer shortly.  Court approves Zoom for defense for next date.
Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bobbie S. Gordon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Bobbie S. Gordon. Def appearing from Burnett County Jail, waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Atty Erdman wishes to waive the prelim today, notes bond motion filed, requests hearing.  Case proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.
